column4: Can someone help me please? I have a CD full of essays that I have burned onto a disk for backup. Now, with my fresh install of Ubuntu, when I try and access the folder a icon of a lock appears and I cant save anything in that folder. How do i remove the lock from the files?
what directory is the locked folder in?
what folder is the locked folder in?
follow the link ubottu gave you.
umm. what is the name of the locked folder?
It is "Free Reformed Stuff". But they are all locked it seems (all the ones from the CD burn).
ok. so do "chmod -R 755 Free Reformed Stuff"
use tab completion to help complete the folder name...
np. BTW, cool to see other reformed people on here... :)
